video.title: Chickens and Pigs - Agile Software Development
video.description:
The term “Chickens and Pigs” was removed from the official Scrum Guide in 2011, but you might hear it used even today. In this brief video, you’ll learn the story behind the term, as well as its history, meaning, and pros and cons.

Video by Agile Coach Chris Gagné: https://chrisgagne.com/

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Ori Geva
topLevelComment.text: Noooo he oinked. It was a nice presentation till he made me cringe at the very end

topLevelComment.author: Riley Shea
topLevelComment.text: I like my stakeholders as I like my food; deep-fried and from Kentucky.  Now excuse me, I have to decide whether to build my house out of hay or brick.

topLevelComment.author: Yo Momma
topLevelComment.text: Oh, god. Super cheesy presentation of topic.

topLevelComment.author: bearded_mucassi
topLevelComment.text: how do I become an Agile coach

replies.author: Chris Gagné
replies.text: I'd suggest starting here: http://www.coachingagileteams.com. Lyssa's book is a wonderful guide. Best of luck! :)
